Are technical writers 'slow'? http://localhost:1313/posts/2022-08-01-are-we-slow/ Mon, 01 Aug 2022 12:30:00 -0400doug@dougcuff.name (Doug Cuff) http://localhost:1313/posts/2022-08-01-are-we-slow/ =======
Are technical writers 'slow'? https://blog.dougcuff.name/posts/2022-08-01-are-we-slow/ Mon, 01 Aug 2022 12:30:00 -0400doug@dougcuff.name (Doug Cuff) https://blog.dougcuff.name/posts/2022-08-01-are-we-slow/ >>>>>>> 12a98bb (Test commit) I spend most of my time at work thinking about the product users. Those are the people who will be reading what I wrote. That means I spend a lot of time considering what each person might not know, and might not know they don’t know. Part of the job of a technical writer is helping people learn. Which puts me in a very different head space than a lot of the people I work with.
